description:
When you unshelve an instance, the instance will be created on a Compute-Node that belongs to an aggregate which  
doesn't have same metadata.

conditions:
　・An cinder volume is attached as a bootable volume.

　・AggregateImagePropertiesIsolation filter is in scheduler_default_filters of /etc/nova/nova.conf file.
　
  ・Propertes are defined in an image's metadata
     For example　key:'CentOS' value:'true'        

  ・two or more aggregates exist.one of which has same metadata as image's Property.　
　・an instance on host that belongs to the aggregate which has same metadata.

 Reproduce steps:
  1.shelve an instance
    # nova shelve UUID

  2.unshlve an instance
    # nova unshelve UUID

Expected result:
 the instance is on a Compute-Node that belongs to an aggregate which has same metadata.

Actual result:
 the instance is on a Compute-Node that belongs to an aggregate which  doesn't have same metadata.

environments:
 Icehouse

comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mzoeller

comments.content:
The filter read the following information:
- Host aggregate(s) metadata
- Image metadata (properties).

Then, it creates a loop using the HA metadata. That means if there is no metadata associated to a host, the loop won't start and the function will return True --> this host will pass. Moreover, if the HA metadata has only a partial set of the image properties, and matches the values, the function will also return True.

What you are expecting is a filter which rejects every host which doesn't match ALL the image properties. Please, take a look to this: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/aggregate-extra-specs-filter

I'm going to ask to Nova:scheduler admins if this filter should be changed (but I don't think so, the change proposed by you is not backwards compatible with existing configurations).

comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mriedem

comments.content:
So, you mention that the actual result is that the instance is unshelved to an host that belongs to an aggregate with a different metadata, right?

What I need to know is that aggregate metadata. The filter actually only compares aggregate metadata if and only if the metadata keys are prefixed by the namespace and the separator defined by config options aggregate_image_properties_isolation_namespace and aggregate_image_properties_isolation_separator. If the host has no metadata attached to the aggregate it belongs to, or if the aggregate has metadata that is not prefixed by the CONF values, then the host is considered valid. This is not a strict enforcement.

See https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/5dbdd6ed2bdcb6e52189e824b3526dde109be017/nova/scheduler/filters/aggregate_image_properties_isolation.py#L44-L47

So, please reply to this to giving us :
 - the destination aggregate metadata
 - CONF.aggregate_image_properties_isolation_namespace value
 - CONF.aggregate_image_properties_isolation_separator value
